message:
Thank you for the interest in the open source #civictech tools for policy crowdsourcing and participatory budgeting.

As highlighted in the video, request the new case study on Facebook advertising for civic tech projects here: http://po.st/CFrequestinfo

The code links on GitHub:
https://github.com/CitizensFoundation/your-priorities-app
https://github.com/CitizensFoundation/open-active-voting
https://github.com/CitizensFoundation/active-citizen

description:
Robert Bjarnason from the Citizens Foundation in Iceland presents on policy crowdsourcing and participatory budgeting tools used in over 20 countries. Presentation starts at 2:10 in and Q+A starts at 22:30.

Get the slides: http://po.st/cfslides
Request the case study: https://citizens.is/contact-us/?cf_source=edem
More: https://citizens.is/?cf_source=edem
In the news: http://po.st/FTworldwatches
 
Thank you to Open Twin Cities for hosting at their Saint Paul, MN meetup - http://opentwincities.org - and Lucas Cioffi with Qiqo Chat - http://qiqochat.com -
 for providing tools for streaming the presentation to Facebook Live.

Event details:
http://blog.e-democracy.org/posts/2739

Icelandâ€™s New Saga: Participatory Budgeting and Policy Crowdsourcing Tech
 
Come join us on Tuesday, December 5th for some Midnight Madness at 6 p.m. at the start of the next Open Twin Cities Meetup in Saint Paul.
 
It will be midnight in Iceland when Robert Bjarnason with Icelandâ€™s Citizens Foundation will join via a live video connection for 45 minutes.

Last week their open source digital idea generation and participatory budgeting tech was featured globally in the Financial Times: The world watches Reykjakikâ€™s digital democracy experiment. If that wasnâ€™t awesome enough, now theyâ€™ve been invited to present at Open Twin Cities. Dream and dream big they have. ðŸ™‚
 
This has the potential to be even bigger than the Kensington Runestone â€¦ an s-mail that took over 500 years to deliver.
